title: Babbacombe Cliff Railway under goes major refurbishment | West Country

organizations.name: babbacombe cliff railway community interest company keeping
babbacombe cliff railway community interest company

text:
Babbacombe Cliff Railway has been transporting people from up on the Downs to Oddicombe Beach since 1926.
The Railway has been shut since Christmas undergoing a major refurbishment.
Work has been done to improve the efficiency and safety of the running gear and new carriages are going to be installed in the next few days.
John Ayres, of the Babbacombe Cliff Railway Community Interest Company, says around £130,000 is being spent on the railway, which has been out of action for the last three months.
Play video We've been here since two thousand and nine and normally we would spend about forty thousand pounds each winter keeping the condition of the Railway in top shape but this year a lot of things have come together and we've had to spend all that sort of money on it so it is major.
– John Ayres, Babbacombe Cliff Railway Community Interest Company Keeping a railway like this up and running has involved a number of refurbishment's over the years and hasn't been cheap.
There are some paid staff but a lot of the work is carried out by volunteers.
120,000 total passengers were carried by the railway last year. It was originally run by the Torquay Tramway company which, of course, is now extinct, and then it was taken over by the local council who ran it until the late ninety nineties when it broke down.
Then it was refurbished and handed over to the Friends of the Cliff Railway, who then became the Babbacombe Cliff Railway Community Interest Company."
– Judith Ayres, Volunteer Last year the Railway carried around 120,000 passengers. Not a bad way to celebrate its 90th anniversary.
The reopening is on schedule and Babbacombe Cliff Railway will soon be back to doing what it does best.
Making life a lot easier for those on the way up.
Last updated Sat 18 Feb 2017 Babbacombe Cliff Railway Devon
